desc: This course immediately precedes SWRK 380. The course provides an overview of how structural oppression across cultural positions (e.g. race, sexuality, ability, class) may affect client systems. Students integrate awareness, knowledge, and skills for engaging in anti-oppressive, inclusive practice with individuals, families, groups, organizations, and communities. This includes role plays assisting clients who are challenged by oppression as part of their presenting problems and brief immersions with diverse communities. Offered annually in September. Counts toward race and ethnic studies major and concentration. Prerequisite: SWRK 261. For senior majors only.
name: Just Practice
notes: Open to rising senior Social Work majors only. This course includes an academic civic engagement (ACE) component.
prerequisites: Prerequisite: SWRK 261. For senior majors only.

revisions.notes: Open to Senior Social Work majors only.
